div.head: To the Right Honourable, Richard, Lord Buckhurst, eldest Sonne and heire apparant to the Right Honourable, Edward, Earle of Dorset, Lord Chamberlaine to her Majesty, one of his Majesties most Honourable Privy Councell, and Knight of the most Noble order of the GARTER.
div.p:
MVltiplicity of words begets multiplicity of errors: especially in those whose tongues
were never polished by Art. It is true, I have much Learning, but that is in my Shop, and it is as true that I am ignorant, having not the happinesse to bee bred a Scholler. Non cuiuis homini licet adire Corinthum. This little Booke (my Lord) being formerly printed, hath received good entertainement: and now that it goes under your protection▪ I doubt not, but it will be much more welcome. The cause of this dedication is to expresse part of my thankefulnesse for
the goodnesse I have received from the Noble Earle your Father, the right vertuous Countesse your Mother, and your Honourable selfe, for which the height of my ambition is onely to be stiled

closer.signed: Your Honours most humbly devoted to serve you Tho. Iones.
